Quote: Hard work pays off in the future. Laziness pays off now.
Author: The Internet

Quote: 3 out of 4 people make up 75% of the population.
Author: The Internet

Quote: 24 hours in a day, 24 beers in a case. Coincidence? You decide.
Author: The Internet

Quote: A banker is a fellow who lends you his umbrella when the sun is shining and wants it back the minute it begins to rain.
Author: Mark Twain

Quote: Accomplishing the impossible means only that the boss will add it to your regular duties.
Author: Doug Larson

Quote: A chicken is an egg's way of making another egg
Author: The Internet

Quote: A closed mouth gathers no foot.
Author: The Internet

Quote: A conscience is what hurts when all your other parts feel so good.
Author: The Internet

Quote: A day for firm decisions! Or is it?
Author: The Internet

Quote: A device that will cut your fuel bills in half - scissors
Author: The Internet

Quote: A dog is a dog unless he is facing you. Then he is Mr. Dog.
Author: The Internet

Quote: A government that robs Peter to pay Paul can always depend on the support of Paul.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: Always try to make other people happy, even if you have to leave them alone to do it
Author: The Internet

Quote: A neat desk is a sign of a cluttered desk drawer.
Author: The Internet

Quote: A neat desk is the sign of a sick mind.
Author: The Internet

Quote: A sentence is something you should never put a preposition at the end of.
Author: The Internet

Quote: A signature always reveals a man's character - and sometimes even his name.
Author: The Internet

Quote: A sine curve goes off to infinity, or at least to the end of the blackboard.
Author: The Internet

Quote: A sure cure for seasickness is to sit under a tree.
Author: Spike Milligan.

Quote: All men can fly, but sadly, only in one direction - down.
Author: The Internet

Quote: All my life I wanted to be someone. I guess I should have been more specific.
Author: The Internet

Quote: Anyone who isn't confused really doesn't understand the situation.
Author: Edward R. Murrow

Quote: Always remember you're unique, just like everyone else.
Author: The Internet

Quote: Anything worth taking seriously is worth making fun of.
Author: The Internet

Quote: Artificial intelligence is no match for natural stupidity.
Author: The Internet

Quote: Beauty is only skin deep, but ugly goes right to the bone
Author: The Internet

Quote: Before you criticize someone, you should walk a mile in their shoes. That way, when you criticize them, you're a mile away, and you have their shoes
Author: The Internet

Quote: Be nice to your kids. They'll choose your nursing home.
Author: The Internet

Quote: Boomerangs are coming back, Ski slopes are going downhill, but Exit signs are on the way out.
Author: The Internet

Quote: Breaking the law of gravity isn't painful it's getting caught that hurts.
Author: The Internet

Quote: Caution: do not look into laser with remaining eye.
Author: The Internet

Quote: Change is inevitable, except from a vending machine.
Author: The Internet

Quote: Democracy is four wolves and a lamb voting on what to have for lunch.
Author: The Internet

Quote: Did you know the word gullible is not in the dictionary?
Author: The Internet

Quote: Diplomacy is the art of saying 'good doggie' while looking for a bigger stick.
Author: The Internet

Quote: Don't personify computers - we don't like it.
Author: The Internet

Quote: Don't use a big word where a diminutive one will suffice.
Author: The Internet

Quote: Don't worry about avoiding temptation - as you grow older, it starts avoiding you.
Author: The Internet

Quote: Don't worry about the world ending today, it's already tomorrow in Australia
Author: The Internet

Quote: Eagles may soar, but weasels don't get sucked into jet engines.
Author: The Internet

Quote: Entertainment is just talking louder than the audience.
Author: The Internet

Quote: Everyone has a photographic memory, some just don't have film.
Author: The Internet

Quote: Everyone is someone else's weirdo.
Author: The Internet

Quote: Experience is something you get just after you need it.
Author: The Internet

Quote: Free jazz is so called because no-one would ever buy it.
Author: The Internet

Quote: Frisbeetarianism: The belief that when you die, your soul goes up on the roof and gets stuck.
Author: The Internet

Quote: Give a man a fish and you feed him for a day. Teach a man to fish, and you can sell him some tackle
Author: The Internet

Quote: Money is not the key to happiness. If you have money you can always have a key made.
Author: The Internet

Quote: Hangover: The wrath of grapes.
Author: The Internet

Quote: Happiness makes up in height what it lacks in length.
Author: The Internet

Quote: As a computer, I find your faith in technology amusing.
Author: The Internet

Quote: Ask me about my vow of silence.
Author: The Internet

Quote: Atheism is a non-prophet organisation.
Author: The Internet

Quote: He who laughs last didn't understand the joke
Author: The Internet

Quote: He's supposed to sound like he's in pain, he's a folk singer.
Author: The Internet

Quote: How do you tell when you run out of invisible ink?
Author: The Internet

Quote: I am not young enough to know everything.
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quote: I didn't say it was your fault. I said I was going to blame you.
Author: The Internet

Quote: I refuse to have a battle of wits with an unarmed opponent.
Author: The Internet

Quote: I used to be indecisive, now I'm not so sure.
Author: The Internet

Quote: I wonder how much deeper the ocean would be without sponges
Author: The Internet

Quote: If you tell the truth, you don't have to remember anything.
Author: The Internet

Quote: If you think nobody cares about you, try missing a couple of mortgage payments.
Author: The Internet

Quote: I'm feeling argumentative. Please contradict me.
Author: The Internet

Quote: I'm having a deja vu experience, just like last time.
Author: The Internet

Quote: If it weren't for the last minute, nothing would get done.
Author: The Internet

Quote: If life was fair, Elvis would be alive and all the impersonators would be dead.
Author: Johnny Carson

Quote: If one synchronized swimmer drowns, do the rest have to drown too?
Author: The Internet

Quote: If today is the first day of the rest of your life, what was yesterday?
Author: The Internet

Quote: If you ate pasta and antipasta, would you still be hungry?
Author: The Internet

Quote: If you strangle a smurf, what color does it turn?
Author: The Internet

Quote: If you lend someone £20, and never see that person again, it was probably worth it.
Author: The Internet

Quote: If you want someone to catch something, throw it at their nose.
Author: The Internet

Quote: It doesn't matter how you get there if you don't know where you're going.
Author: The Internet

Quote: It is dangerous to be right in matters on which the established authorities are wrong.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: It's a small world, but I'd hate to have to paint it.
Author: The Internet

Quote: It's not the heights that bother me it's falling on the bottoms of them.
Author: The Internet

Quote: I've got a mind like a.. a.. what's that thing called?
Author: The Internet

Quote: I've had amnesia for as long as I can remember
Author: The Internet

Quote: Life is what happens to you while you're busy making other plans.
Author: John Lennon

Quote: Millions yearn for immortality who don't know what to do with themselves on a rainy Sunday afternoon.
Author: Susan Ertz

Quote: My favourite scientific theory is that the rings of Saturn are made of lost airline luggage.
Author: The Internet

Quote: My supply of brain cells is finally down to a manageable size
Author: The Internet

Quote: Never ask a barber if he thinks you need a haircut.
Author: The Internet

Quote: Never attribute to malice what can be adequately explained by stupidity.
Author: The Internet

Quote: Never test the depth of the water with both feet.
Author: The Internet

Quote: No issue is so small that it can't be blown out of proportion.
Author: Stuart Hughes

Quote: No one is listening until you make a mistake.
Author: The Internet

Quote: No problem is so big that you can't run away from it.
Author: The Internet

Quote: Of course, you may smoke - but please don't exhale.
Author: The Internet

Quote: On the other hand, I have some fingers.
Author: The Internet

Quote: Personifiers of the world! Unite! You have nothing to lose but Mr. Dignity!
Author: The Internet

Quote: Pound for pound, the amoeba is the most vicious animal on earth.
Author: The Internet

Quote: Rome wasn't built in a day, it just looks like that.
Author: The Internet

Quote: Smash forehead on keyboard to continue.
Author: The Internet

Quote: Some days you are the fly, other days you are the windscreen.
Author: The Internet

Quote: That's OK. I don't remember my name either.
Author: The Internet

Quote: The amount of sleep needed by the average person is ten minutes more.
Author: The Internet

Quote: The early bird gets the worm, but the early worm gets eaten.
Author: The Internet

Quote: The face of a child can say it all, especially the mouth part of the face.
Author: The Internet

Quote: The lion and the calf shall lie down together but the calf won't get much sleep.
Author: Woody Allen

Quote: The race is not always to the swift, nor the battle to the strong - but that's the way to bet.
Author: Damon Runyon

Quote: The trouble with being punctual is that nobody's there to appreciate it.
Author: Franklin P. Jones

Quote: There are two kinds of people, those who do the work and those who take the credit. Try to be in the first group; there is less competition there.
Author: Indira Gandhi

Quote: There are three kinds of people - those who can count, and those who can't.
Author: The Internet

Quote: There's no future in time travel.
Author: The Internet

Quote: Time flies like an arrow, fruit flies like a banana
Author: The Internet

Quote: To steal ideas from one person is plagiarism; to steal from many is research.
Author: The Internet

Quote: 'Veni, Vidi, Velcro' - I came, I saw, I stuck around.
Author: The Internet

Quote: 'Veni, Vidi, Visa'. I came. I Saw. I did a little shopping.
Author: The Internet

Quote: What sets us apart from animals is that we're not afraid of vacuum cleaners.
Author: The Internet

Quote: When a stupid man is doing something he is ashamed of, he always declares that it is his duty.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: You don't need an engine to go downhill.
Author: The Internet

Quote: It's important to have an open mind, but not so open that your brains fall out.
Author: The Internet

Quote: The DOPELER Effect is the tendency of stupid ideas to seem smarter when they come at you rapidly
Author: The Internet

Quote: 25% of the general population believe in statistics. The other 80% don't trust them at all.
Author: The Internet

Quote: 95% of statistics are just made up anyway.
Author: The Internet

Quote: A new study shows that licking the sweat off a frog can cure depression. The down side is, the minute you stop licking, the frog gets depressed again.
Author: The Internet

Quote: Anything not nailed down is mine. Anything I can pry loose is not nailed down.
Author: The Internet

Quote: I always win. Except when I lose, but then I just don't count it.
Author: The Internet

Quote: I went to a restaurant that was so expensive that they didn't have prices on the menu - just little faces with varying expressions of horror.
Author: The Internet

Quote: The person who knows how to laugh at himself will never cease to be amused
Author: The Internet

Quote: Where in the nursery rhyme does it say Humpty Dumpty is an egg?
Author: The Internet

Quote: It is impossible to make anything foolproof because fools are so ingenious.
Author: The Internet

Quote: The trouble with doing something right the first time, is nobody appreciates how difficult it was.
Author: The Internet

Quote: Everybody lies, but it doesn't matter since nobody listens.
Author: The Internet

Quote: When I was born, I was so surprised, I couldn't talk for a year and a half!
Author: The Internet

Quote: To err is human, to blame the next guy even more so.
Author: The Internet

Quote: There are two rules for success... 1) Never tell everything you know.
Author: The Internet

Quote: Be nice to other people; they outnumber you 5.5 billion to one.
Author: The Internet

Quote: Courage is the art of being the only one that knows you're scared to death.
Author: Earl Wilson

Quote: Even if you're on the right track, you'll get run over if you just sit there.
Author: Will Rogers

Quote: I have given up anarchy. Too many rules - hating the government and all that stuff.
Author: G.H. Hill

Quote: The only reason some people get lost in thought because it is unfamiliar territory.
Author: The Internet

Quote: Talk is cheap because supply exceeds demand
Author: The Internet

Quote: Start every day off with a smile and get it over with.
Author: The Internet

Quote: Just because something doesn't do what you planned it to do doesn't mean it's useless.
Author: The Internet

Quote: There are two kinds of people, those who finish what they start and so on.
Author: The Internet

Quote: It is the dull man who is always sure, and the sure man who is always dull.
Author: H. L. Mencken

Quote: A great many people think they are thinking when they are merely rearranging their prejudices.
Author: William James

Quote: Half of the people in the world are below average.
Author: The Internet

Quote: Male zebras have white stripes, female zebras have black stripes.
Author: The Internet

Quote: Computers are useless. They can only give answers.
Author: The Internet

Quote: There has been an alarming increase in the number of things you know absolutely nothing about.
Author: The Internet

Quote: Never keep up with the Joneses. Drag them down to your level. It's cheaper.
Author: Quentin Crisp

Quote: There are only two industries that refer to their customers as 'users'.
Author: Edward Tufte

Quote: I loathe people who keep dogs. They are cowards who haven't got the guts to bite people themselves.
Author: August Strindberg

Quote: Even if you win the rat race, you're still a rat.
Author: The Internet

Quote: For every problem there is a solution which is simple, neat and wrong.
Author: The Internet

Quote: Natives who beat drums to drive off evil spirits are objects of scorn to smart people who blow horns to break up traffic jams.
Author: The Internet

Quote: All sweeping generalisations are wrong.
Author: The Internet

Quote: I avoid clichés like the plague.
Author: The Internet

Quote: My sources are unreliable, but their information is fascinating.
Author: The Internet

Quote: Believe those who seek the truth; doubt those that find it.
Author: Andre Gide

Quote: When you find yourself in a hole, the first thing to do is stop digging.
Author: The Internet

Quote: Democracy is the worst possible form of government, except for all the others.
Author: The Internet

Quote: We have the finest politicians that money can buy.
Author: The Internet

Quote: Never explain -- your Friends do not need it and your enemies will not believe you anyway.
Author: The Internet

Quote: If it's stupid but works, it isn't stupid.
Author: The Internet

Quote: It is a miracle that curiosity survives formal education.
Author: Albert Einstein

Quote: I used to know everything, till everything changed.
Author: Sgt Phil Girvan

Quote: You can have peace, or you can have freedom. Don't ever count on having both at once.
Author: The Internet

Quote: Anything free is worth the price.
Author: The Internet

Quote: Always listen to experts. They'll tell you what can't be done, and why. Then go and do it anyway.
Author: The Internet

Quote: All that is necessary for the forces of evil to take root in the world is for enough good men to do nothing.
Author: Edmund Burke

Quote: I find television very educational. Every time someone switches it on I go into another room and read a good book.
Author: Groucho Marx

Quote: Wisdom has two parts: 1) Having a lot to say, and 2) not saying it.
Author: The Internet

Quote: I'm not stupid. I just have a command of thoroughly useless information.
Author: The Internet

Quote: People will accept your ideas much more readily if you tell them Benjamin Franklin said it first.
Author: The Internet

Quote: The two most common elements in the universe are hydrogen and stupidity.
Author: Isaac Asimov

Quote: Compromise is the art of dividing a cake so everyone believes he got the biggest piece.
Author: Ludwig Erhard

Quote: It is the nature of emergencies to be inconvenient.
Author: Terri Weiner

Quote: It's extremely unlucky to be superstitious, for no other reason than it is always unlucky to be colossally stupid.
Author: Stephen Fry

Quote: Opportunity is missed by most people because it is dressed in overalls and looks like work.
Author: Thomas Edison

Quote: Don't go around saying the world owes you a living. The world owes you nothing; it was here first.
Author: Mark Twain

Quote: It's better to be boldly decisive and risk being wrong than to agonize at length and be right too late.
Author: Marilyn Kennedy

Quote: A good plan today is better than a perfect plan tomorrow. -Gen.
Author: George Patton

Quote: Man will occassionally stumble over the truth, but most of the time he will pick himself up and continue on.
Author: Winston Churchill

Quote: It is better to have enough ideas for some of them to be wrong than to always be right by having no ideas at all.
Author: Edward de Bono

Quote: The world is moving so fast these days that the man who says it can't be done is generally interrupted by someone doing it.
Author: Elbert Hubbard

Quote: It's a small world, but I wouldn't like to paint it.
Author: The Internet

Quote: I don't suffer from insanity, I enjoy every minute of it.
Author: The Internet

Quote: It's lonely at the top, but the food is better.
Author: The Internet

Quote: Pride is what we have.  Vanity is what others have.
Author: The Internet

Quote: Give me ambiguity or give me something else.
Author: The Internet

Quote: Consciousness: that annoying time between naps.
Author: The Internet

Quote: Why is abbreviation such a long word?
Author: The Internet

Quote: We have enough youth, how about a fountain of Smart?
Author: The Internet

Quote: Time is what keeps everything from happening all at once.
Author: The Internet

Quote: Computers in the future may weigh no more than 1.5 tons.
Author: Popular Mechanics, 1949

Quote: I think there is a world market for maybe five computers.
Author: Thomas Watson, chairman of IBM, 1943

Quote: If you don't find what you want in the Index, look very carefully through the entire catalogue.
Author: The Internet

Quote: Computers make very fast, very accurate mistakes.
Author: The Internet

Quote: Computers are not intelligent. They only think they are.
Author: The Internet

Quote: Imagine if every thursday your shoes exploded if you tied them in the usual way. This happens to us all the time with computers, and nobody thinks of complaining!
Author: The Internet

Quote: Tell a man there are 300 billion stars in the universe and he'll believe you. Tell him a seat has wet paint on it and he'll have to touch it to be sure.
Author: The Internet

Quote: If you need anything please don't hesitate to ask someone else first.
Author: The Internet

Quote: Some mornings, it's just not worth chewing through the leather straps.
Author: The Internet

Quote: The statistics on sanity are that one out of every four people is suffering from some form of mental illness. Think of your three best friends. If they're okay, then it's you.
Author: The Internet

Quote: If it weren't for electricity we'd all be watching television by candlelight.
Author: The Internet

Quote: You cannot have everything. I mean, where would you put it?
Author: The Internet

Quote: I will not eat oysters. I want my food dead. Not sick, not wounded, dead.
Author: Woody Allen

Quote: If toast always lands butter-side down, and cats always land on their feet, what happens if you drop a buttered cat?
Author: The Internet

Quote: Nouvelle Cuisine, roughly translated, means: I can't believe I paid ninety-six pounds and I'm still hungry.
Author: The Internet

Quote: I went to a restaurant that serves 'breakfast at any time'. So I ordered French Toast during the Renaissance.
Author: The Internet

Quote: I went to a General Store, but they wouldn't sell me anything specific.
Author: The Internet

Quote: A positive attitude will not solve all your problems, but it will annoy enough people to make it worth the effort.
Author: The Internet

Quote: This year's Psychic Fair will be held on June 23rd. In the event of rain, it will be held the previous Saturday.
Author: The Internet

Quote: 'Of course,' said my grandfather, pulling a gun from his belt as he stepped from the Time Machine, 'There's no paradox if I shoot YOU'.
Author: The Internet

Quote: In theory, there is no difference between theory and practice. But, in practice, there is.
Author: The Internet

Quote: The only difference between me and a madman is that I'm not mad.
Author: Salvador Dali

Quote: Never interrupt your enemy when he is making a mistake.
Author: Napoleon Bonaparte

Quote: I have not failed. I've just found 10,000 ways that won't work.
Author: Thomas Alva Edison

Quote: A witty saying proves nothing.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: Some drink at the fountain of knowledge...others just gargle.
Author: The Internet

Quote: It's not an optical illusion, it just looks that way.
Author: The Internet

Quote: When all else fails, read the instructions.
Author: The Internet

Quote: Smile, it makes people wonder what you're thinking.
Author: The Internet

Quote: Practice makes perfeckt.
Author: The Internet

Quote: If you can remember the '60s, then you weren't there.
Author: The Internet

Quote: There is no surer way to ruin a good discussion than to contaminate it with facts.
Author: The Internet

Quote: I can't make predictions and I never will
Author: The Internet

Quote: The second best policy is dishonesty
Author: The Internet

Quote: If it boils and is watched, it can't be a pot.
Author: The Internet

Quote: I argue very well. Ask any of my remaining friends. I can win an argument on any topic, against any opponent. People know this, and steer clear of me at parties.
Author: The Internet

Quote: If at first you don't succeed, then skydiving definitely isn't for you.
Author: The Internet

Quote: If a vegetarian eats vegetables, what does a humanitarian eat?
Author: The Internet

Quote: How can a slim chance and a fat chance be the same?
Author: The Internet

Quote: For business reasons, I must maintain the outward signs of sanity.
Author: Mark Twain

Quote: The trouble with the world is that the stupid are cocksure and the intelligent are full of doubt.
Author: Bertrand Russell

Quote: Only newspaper editors and people with tapeworms should ever refer to themselves as, 'we'
Author: Mark Twain

Quote: It is better to remain silent and be thought a fool than to open one's mouth and remove all doubt
Author: Mark Twain

Quote: Hey boss, watch this!
Author: The Internet

Quote: It is best to mince one's words very finely, it makes them much easier to eat afterwards.
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quote: Never give up, never give up, never, never, never give up!
Author: Winston Churchill

Quote: Underneath the skin, all humanity are brothers and I would gladly skin humanity alive to prove it.
Author: Ellsworth Toohey

Quote: There is nothing either good or bad, but thinking makes it so.
Author: Shakespeare

Quote: I guess when you turn off the main road, you have to be prepared to see some funny houses.
Author: Stephen King

Quote: Never let your sense of morals prevent you from doing what is right.
Author: The Internet

Quote: When I was a kid my favorite relative was Uncle Caveman. After school we'd all go play in his cave, and every once in a while he would eat one of us. It wasn't until later that I found out that Uncle Caveman was a bear.
Author: The Internet

Quote: Take my advice: If the recipe calls for ""3 handfuls of lava,"" it's really not worth the effort.
Author: The Internet

Quote: Those are my principles. If you don't like them I have others.
Author: Groucho Marx.

Quote: Beer is proof that God loves us and wants us to be happy
Author: Benjamin Franklin

Quote: There are 10 types of people in this world; those who understand the binary number system and those who do not
Author: The Internet

Quote: He was a great patriot, a humanitarian, a loyal friend; provided, of course, he really is dead.
Author: Voltaire.

Quote: Outside of the killings, Washington has one of the lowest crime rates in the country
Author: Mayor Marion Barry, Washington DC

Quote: Every time I close the door on reality it comes in through the windows.
Author: The Internet

Quote: Thirty-five is when you finally get your head together and your body starts falling apart.
Author: The Internet

Quote: The tragedy of life doesn't lie in not reaching your goal. The tragedy lies in having no goal to reach.
Author: The Internet

Quote: No great man ever complains of want of opportunity.
Author: The Internet

Quote: It isn't pollution that's harming the environment, it's the impurities in our air and water that are doing it
Author: Dan Quayle, Former US Vice President

Quote: What if, at this very moment, you are living up to your full potential?
Author: The Internet

Quote: Sanity calms, but madness is more interesting.
Author: The Internet

Quote: Don't talk about yourself so much... we'll do that when you leave.
Author: The Internet

Quote: If you try and don't succeed, cheat. Repeat until caught. Then lie.
Author: The Internet

Quote: Never say ""OOPS!"" always say ""Ah, Interesting!""
Author: The Internet

Quote: This isn't burger king, you can't have it your way.
Author: The Internet

Quote: If you must choose between two evils, pick the one you've never tried before.
Author: The Internet

Quote: Everything that can be invented has been invented.
Author: Charles H. Duell, Commissioner, U.S. Office of Patents, 1899.

The abdomen, the chest, and the brain will forever be shut from the intrusion of the wise and humane surgeon. -Sir John Eric Ericksen, British surgeon, appointed Surgeon-Extraordinary to Queen Victoria 1873.

Quote: Louis Pasteur's theory of germs is ridiculous fiction.
Author: Pierre Pachet, Professor of Physiology at Toulouse, 1872

Quote: Who the hell wants to hear actors talk?
Author: H.M. Warner, Warner Brothers, 1927.

Quote: We don't like their sound, and guitar music is on the way out.
Author: Decca Recording Co. rejecting the Beatles, 1962.

Quote: Heavier-than-air flying machines are impossible.
Author: Lord Kelvin, president, Royal Society, 1895.

Quote: Two times a week, we go to a nice restaurant, a little wine, good food and companionship. She goes Mondays, I go Fridays.
Author: The Internet

Quote: Women will never be equal to men until they can walk down the street with a bald head and a beer gut, and still think they are beautiful
Author: The Internet
